Package ObjectStateTracker

Class ObjectStateTracker<O extends Observable,S>

java.lang.Object
ObjectStateTracker.ObjectStateTracker<O,S>
Type Parameters:
O - the type of the observable objects being tracked
S - the type of the states associated with the objects
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<O>, Observer
public class ObjectStateTracker<O extends Observable,S> extends Object implements Iterable<O>, Observer
A class that tracks the state of objects and their trajectories.
Author:
Gonzalo Jim√©nez and Luis Pastor

  • Method Details

    • withState

      public ObjectStateTracker<O,S> withState(S state, Predicate<O> function) throws IllegalStateException
      Adds a state and its associated function to the ObjectStateTracker.
      Parameters:
      state - the state to be added
      function - the function that determines if an object is in the state
      Returns:
      the ObjectStateTracker instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the state does not exist in the initial list of states

    • elseState

      public ObjectStateTracker<O,S> elseState(S state) throws IllegalStateException
      Sets the default state for objects that do not match any other state.
      Parameters:
      state - the default state to be set
      Returns:
      the ObjectStateTracker instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the state does not exist in the initial list of states

    • addObjects

      public void addObjects(O... objects)
      Adds objects to be tracked by the ObjectStateTracker.
      Parameters:
      objects - the objects to be added

    • updateStates

      public void updateStates()
      Updates the states of the tracked objects.

    • update

      public void update(Observable object, Object arg)
      This method is called when an observed object notifies a change. It updates the states of the object.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      object - the observed object that triggered the update
      arg - an argument passed by the observed object (optional)

    • iterator

      public Iterator<O> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the objects in this ObjectStateTracker.
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<O extends Observable>
      Returns:
      an iterator over the objects in this ObjectStateTracker

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the ObjectStateTracker. The string representation contains the information of each state and the objects associated with each state.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the ObjectStateTracker

    • trajectory

      public Trajectory<S> trajectory(O o)
      Gets the trajectory of the specified object.
      Parameters:
      o - the object to get the trajectory for
      Returns:
      the trajectory of the object, or null if it is not saved
